creator: j.chetwynd@btinternet.com
text:
Can one configure mod_autoindex to create and serve a page in another web language than html, eg svg, xhtml, xml, json etc...?
ie a document listing the files and sub-directories.

apologies if this should be a documentation bug or wishlist, or possibly even my failure to rfd.

appreciate that one could alternatively create an index.svg, but...

**http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_autoindex.html

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Leaving open and changing to enhancement. mod_autoindex doesn't know how to generate such output today, but if you're interested in alternatiives the users' mailing list is probably the right spot.

http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

Patches to 2.x are welcome, 1.3 is no longer in maintenance.

p.s. the output of current mod_autoindex 2.x should be well-formed xml.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
j.chetwynd@btinternet.com
text:
#2

leaving a bug until the version is no longer maintained is not a rational reason for assigning as wontfix.

jonathon,

I answered you that the output of mod_autoindex, modulo any readme/header content
that violates the principal, should be xml parsable.  If not, please let us know
what should be improved.

Otherwise, you listed a smattering of protocols.  Pick -one- per bug, offer one
patch per bug to introduce that format.

The problem is that mod_autoindex must be presentation-ready for human users,
since humans are the principal users.  Services should be able to consume that
human readable response.  Any format understood vis-a-vie HTML/5.0 and related
modern browser standards would be fine.

But I believe mod_autoindex is xhtml/xml compatible today, please review the
XHTML http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_autoindex.html#indexoptions and
let us know (in specific) what your desired enhancement is.
